intro: Teucrium rotundifolium subsp. granatense, commonly known as granate germander, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features aromatic, gray-green foliage with rounded, often succulent leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional remedies.
